headline.main: The Diet Wheel Again Spins To Protein

docs.lead_paragraph: FRAN McCULLOUGH, a book editor in Manhattan who has lost 60 pounds in the last year, is relishing the response of people who haven't seen her for a while ("Is that really you, Fran?"). Friends of Janet Pope, a decorative artist in Baltimore, shake their heads in awe at her weight loss -- 56 pounds in 13 months -- accomplished, like Ms. McCullough's, by cutting down on carbohydrates and concentrating on protein. Buoyed by these testimonials from carbohydrate dropouts, driven by curiosity and burdened with 14 surplus pounds, I joined the protein packers for five weeks. It was in direct opposition to my normal, deeply committed, plant-based complex-carbohydrate life.
